title.narrative: Darimu Integrated Rural Development Project (DIRP) phase two

description.narrative: Poverty is one of the major factors limiting the realization of the Millennium Development Goals (MDG) in Ethiopia. To curb this problem the effort of the Ethiopian government alone is not sufficient. Darimu Intergrated Rural Development Project has been d esigned to support this effort. The overall goal of the project is to assist the national in reduction of poverty and mitigating its impact the project is targeting to contribute to the improve the development problems in the area:Not enough clean water bu t water born diseases. Education is not available for all and not for girls especially. No access to clinics hospitals and government offices during the rainy season. Not enough income generating possibilities for women and unemployed youth. Sexual absuse of the girls living in the rental houses while studing in Dupha. Overall objectives: Poverty reduction Gender equalization Access to clean water Education for all.The direct beneficiaries are the inhabitants of Darimu woreda 24 956 (12 458 male and 12 498 female) but living in the different kebeles than beneficiaries in the first phase of the project. The main project activities are: Meti-Dheko kebele gets the healt post. Kussaye school children are getting school buildings and toilets. 180 women get traini ng in ruminant rearing and goat or sheep.160 women and 20 unemployed youth in saving and credit schemes in eight kebeles.50 girls and 50 boys get the dormitory.Two walking bridges constructed over Golol river and Asas river.25 spring protection / hand dug wells construction 25 water commitees trained.Gender has been a mainstreaming theme while planning the second phase. When the schools are found at short distances and there are separate toilets for girls and boys it helps the girls especially in their teen s to come to school. The problem of young female students living in rental houses and being abused is reduces by building them proper dormitories to live together. Having protected springs reduces the working load of women reduces waterborne diseases reduc es the money spent on medicine and visits to the doctor. Bridges help women to have shorter ways to carry their products to the markets. Schoolchildren have safer way to school. Heath post with facilities reduces MDG/maternity and child mortality. Saving a nd Credit schemes and small ruminant credits are income generating for women and unemployed youth with training how to save money and how to raise animals.
